      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Lennon Figtree should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling apples for 12 coins a basket.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Lennon Figtree's Summary of recent observations:
          [13 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are haggling over the price, as Lennon believes Cedric's prices are too high.
          Lennon Figtree's The current date/time is:
          14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently at the market in Fruitville negotiating the price of fruit with Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Query
        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree is currently at the market in Fruitville negotiating the price of fruit with Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "These pears are the finest in Fruitville, Della. Grown with care and sunshine.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Lennon Figtree should remember that Della Plumstone is a potential customer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Lennon Figtree should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling apples for 12 coins a basket.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What'll it be, Lennon? Finest fruit in Fruitville, guaranteed.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          Answer: [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Lennon Figtree should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling apples for 12 coins a basket.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-14 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation
      • What actions should Cedric Meadowbrook take to achieve the desired situation?
          Key

        • Question: What actions should Cedric Meadowbrook take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Cedric Meadowbrook should try to sell the bananas to Lennon Figtree at a price higher than 2 coins.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "These pears are the finest in Fruitville, Della. Grown with care and sunshine.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They certainly look lovely, Lennon, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my purse, don't you think?
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 3 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of apples?
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Della Plumstone is interested in buying a basket of apples.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, a basket of my finest apples is worth at least 15 coins, but for a valued customer like yourself, I'd be willing to part with them for 12.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed apple for 5 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [recent memory] Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Della Plumstone proposed a price of 5 coins for a basket of apples.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 2 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 6 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Lennon Figtree is interested in buying fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What'll it be, Lennon? Finest fruit in Fruitville, guaranteed.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "That's a bit steep, Cedric.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed banana for 2 coins
          Expected Situation:: Cedric Meadowbrook is most looking forward to making a profit from selling fruit.
          Question: What actions should Cedric Meadowbrook take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Cedric Meadowbrook should try to sell the bananas to Lennon Figtree at a price higher than 2 coins.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it indicates that Lennon Figtree might be willing to negotiate a lower price for the bananas.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed banana for 2 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [13 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price for a banana with Lennon Figtree.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What'll it be, Lennon? Finest fruit in Fruitville, guaranteed.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Lennon Figtree is interested in buying fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 6 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.

          Question: What should Cedric Meadowbrook remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Lennon Figtree proposed a price of 2 coins for a banana.

          Question: What situation is Cedric Meadowbrook most looking forward to?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is most looking forward to making a profit from selling fruit.

          Question: What actions should Cedric Meadowbrook take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Cedric Meadowbrook should try to sell the bananas to Lennon Figtree at a price higher than 2 coins.

          Question: What memory from Cedric Meadowbrook's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Lennon Figtree previously stated that the price of the bananas was "a bit steep.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it indicates that Lennon Figtree might be willing to negotiate a lower price for the bananas.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [13 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 14 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price for a banana with Lennon Figtree.

        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price for a banana with Lennon Figtree.

        • The relevant memory for the current situation is that Lennon Figtree previously stated that the price of the bananas was "a bit steep.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "These pears are the finest in Fruitville, Della. Grown with care and sunshine.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "They certainly look lovely, Lennon, but 3 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for my purse, don't you think?

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is attempting to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently in a negotiation with Lennon Figtree over the price of a banana.
          Query
        • Cedric Meadowbrook, Cedric Meadowbrook is attempting to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently in a negotiation with Lennon Figtree over the price of a banana.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 13 years old, he helped his father barter with a neighboring farmer for a sack of potatoes. The farmer, a shrewd negotiator, tried to take advantage of Cedric's youth, offering a meager amount for their finest apples. Cedric, remembering his father's lessons, stood his ground, calmly and politely arguing for a fairer price until they reached a mutually agreeable deal.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 16 years old, he secretly sold a portion of the orchard's harvest to a merchant who offered a price far below market value. He used the money to buy a worn map of the world, dreaming of escaping the confines of the orchard and embarking on his own adventures.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, his father fell ill, and Cedric took over the responsibility of running the orchard. He worked tirelessly, his youthful enthusiasm tempered by a newfound understanding of the weight of responsibility. However, the orchard felt like a gilded cage, and the yearning for freedom grew stronger with each passing day.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, after his father's death, Cedric sold the orchard and bought a small cart. He filled it with apples from the orchard, the last tangible connection to his past, and set out on the road, a mixture of excitement and guilt churning in his stomach.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed pear for 5 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed pear for 5 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "These pears are the finest in Fruitville, Della. Grown with care and sunshine.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 4 coins

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Which fruit would Della Plumstone like to buy and what price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) apple for 5 coins
          (b) pear for 5 coins
          (c) apple for 1 coins
          (d) banana for 6 coins
          (e) pear for 1 coins
          (f) banana for 5 coins
          (g) banana for 1 coins
          (h) banana for 2 coins
          (i) pear for 6 coins
          (j) banana for 4 coins
          (k) apple for 6 coins
          (l) apple for 3 coins
          (m) apple for 2 coins
          (n) banana for 3 coins
          (o) apple for 4 coins
          (p) pear for 2 coins
          (q) pear for 3 coins
          (r) pear for 4 coins
          Answer: (b)

Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Lennon.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Morning, Della.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.


          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market negotiating fruit prices with Lennon Figtree. She plans to resell the fruit in her home town for a profit.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of apples?
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Lennon Figtree for some fruit.

          Initial chain of thought
        • Statements:
          Della Plumstone's Summary of recent observations:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the Fruitville market negotiating fruit prices with Lennon Figtree. She plans to resell the fruit in her home town for a profit.
          Della Plumstone's The current date/time is:
          15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is trying to buy fruit at a low price at the Fruitville market so she can resell it for a higher price elsewhere.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is trying to buy fruit at a low price at the Fruitville market so she can resell it for a higher price elsewhere.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [28 Oct 1875 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 6 years old, she watched her father, a fruit vendor, haggle with a customer over the price of a basket of apples. The customer, a burly man with a booming laugh, tried to lowball him, but Della's father stood his ground, his voice firm and unwavering. Della saw the determination in her father's eyes, the way he refused to be taken advantage of, and a seed of admiration took root within her.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she overheard two merchants discussing a shipment of plums that had gone bad. One of them, a shrewd-looking man with a thin mustache, suggested dumping the spoiled fruit and claiming it had been stolen. Della listened intently, her mind racing. She realized that the world was a harsh place, where people would do anything to get ahead, even if it meant resorting to deceit.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, her father fell ill, unable to work. Della took over his stall at the market, her young face hardened with resolve. She bartered with customers, her voice sharp and efficient, determined to keep the business afloat.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she traveled to a neighboring town to sell her fruit. A group of boys, drunk and rowdy, tried to cheat her out of her earnings. Della stood her ground, her eyes cold and unwavering, and refused to back down. She knew that fear was a weakness, and she would not be intimidated.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, she made her first major purchase, a cart to transport her goods. She spent weeks haggling with the seller, her mind calculating every detail, every penny. The cart was a symbol of her independence, her ability to stand on her own two feet.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • accept
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation

        • Question: What actions should Lennon Figtree take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Lennon Figtree should accept Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins for a pear.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 4 coins
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [recent memory] Lennon Figtree should remember that Della Plumstone offered 4 coins for a kilogram of pears.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of apples?
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, a basket of my finest apples is worth at least 15 coins, but for a valued customer like yourself, I'd be willing to part with them for 12.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life.         ReasonForMemoryRelevance
      • Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Lennon Figtree?
          Key

        • Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Lennon Figtree?
          Answer
          State
        • The reason this memory is relevant is because it provides context for the current negotiation. Knowing Della Plumstone previously offered 4 coins for pears gives Lennon Figtree insight into her potential willingness to pay and helps him strategize his counter-offer.

          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Lennon Figtree should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling apples for 12 coins a basket.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "That's a bit steep, Cedric.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [recent memory] Lennon Figtree should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling apples for 12 coins a basket.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed banana for 2 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Lennon.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Lennon Figtree should remember that Della Plumstone is interested in buying fruit.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Morning, Della.

          Answer: Lennon Figtree is most looking forward to selling fruit and making a profit.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • accept
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 5 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price for a pear with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Lennon Figtree should remember that Della Plumstone is interested in buying fruit.

          Question: What should Lennon Figtree remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree should remember that Della Plumstone offered 5 coins for a pear.

          Question: What situation is Lennon Figtree most looking forward to?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is most looking forward to selling fruit and making a profit.

          Question: What actions should Lennon Figtree take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Lennon Figtree should accept Della Plumstone's offer of 5 coins for a pear.

          Question: What memory from Lennon Figtree's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Della Plumstone offered 4 coins for a kilogram of pears.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it provides context for the current negotiation. Knowing Della Plumstone previously offered 4 coins for pears gives Lennon Figtree insight into her potential willingness to pay and helps him strategize his counter-offer.

          Question: Would Lennon Figtree accept the offer?:
          (a) reject
          (b) accept
          Answer: (b)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Final chain of thought

Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed pear for 2 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed pear for 2 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: pear for 2 coins

Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.

          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for some fruit.

          Question: Which fruit would Della Plumstone like to buy and what price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) apple for 1 coins
          (b) banana for 2 coins
          (c) pear for 4 coins
          (d) pear for 6 coins
          (e) apple for 5 coins
          (f) pear for 5 coins
          (g) apple for 3 coins
          (h) pear for 2 coins
          (i) banana for 4 coins
          (j) banana for 1 coins
          (k) apple for 2 coins
          (l) pear for 3 coins
          (m) pear for 1 coins
          (n) banana for 6 coins
          (o) banana for 5 coins
          (p) apple for 4 coins
          (q) banana for 3 coins
          (r) apple for 6 coins
          Answer: (h)
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for some fruit.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 4 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of apples?
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, a basket of my finest apples is worth at least 15 coins, but for a valued customer like yourself, I'd be willing to part with them for 12.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed apple for 5 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What'll it be, Lennon? Finest fruit in Fruitville, guaranteed.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "That's a bit steep, Cedric.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Morning, Della.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Lennon.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 5 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Good morning, Della! Back for more of my fine fruit, I see?"
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Cedric. Your apples are looking particularly fine today.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-16 00:10:00.


          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a merchant who buys and sells fruit in Fruitville. She recently made a successful deal with Lennon Figtree and is currently negotiating a price with Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Cedric. Your apples are looking particularly fine today.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 6 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for some fruit.

        • 1895-09-16 00:10:00

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a fruit merchant in Fruitville who recently had a successful deal with Lennon Figtree and is currently negotiating with Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is a fruit merchant in Fruitville who recently had a successful deal with Lennon Figtree and is currently negotiating with Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • accept
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation
      • What actions should Cedric Meadowbrook take to achieve the desired situation?
          Key

        • Question: What actions should Cedric Meadowbrook take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Cedric Meadowbrook should carefully consider the costs of the fruit from the farm and the prices customers are willing to pay. He should aim to negotiate prices that allow him to make a profit on each sale.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 3 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Della Plumstone is interested in buying a basket of apples.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of apples?
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [recent memory] Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Della Plumstone proposed a price of 5 coins for a basket of apples.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 2 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed apple for 5 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 6 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Lennon Figtree is interested in buying fruit.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What'll it be, Lennon? Finest fruit in Fruitville, guaranteed.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "That's a bit steep, Cedric.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed banana for 2 coins

He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 2 coins.

        ExpectedSituation
      • What situation is Cedric Meadowbrook most looking forward to?
          Key

        • Question: What situation is Cedric Meadowbrook most looking forward to?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook is most looking forward to selling fruit at a good price and making a profit.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 3 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 2 coins.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • accept
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 2 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit seller at the Fruitville market trying to sell his produce to Della Plumstone. Della is interested in buying pears.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Della Plumstone is interested in buying a basket of apples.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Dewdrops clung to the colorful fruits displayed in the market of Fruitville, reflecting the soft morning light. The air buzzed with anticipation as traders and customers alike gathered for the day's trade. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 3 coins; banana for 6 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Della Plumstone is interested in buying fruit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 2 coins.

          Question: What should Cedric Meadowbrook remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Della Plumstone proposed a price of 2 coins for a pear.

          Question: What situation is Cedric Meadowbrook most looking forward to?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is most looking forward to selling fruit at a good price and making a profit.

          Question: What actions should Cedric Meadowbrook take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Cedric Meadowbrook should carefully consider the costs of the fruit from the farm and the prices customers are willing to pay. He should aim to negotiate prices that allow him to make a profit on each sale.

          Question: What memory from Cedric Meadowbrook's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Della Plumstone is interested in buying fruit.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because it indicates that Della Plumstone is a potential customer and Cedric is trying to sell fruit.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (a)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 19 years old, his father fell ill, and Cedric took over the responsibility of running the orchard. He worked tirelessly, his youthful enthusiasm tempered by a newfound understanding of the weight of responsibility. However, the orchard felt like a gilded cage, and the yearning for freedom grew stronger with each passing day.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was 21 years old, after his father's death, Cedric sold the orchard and bought a small cart. He filled it with apples from the orchard, the last tangible connection to his past, and set out on the road, a mixture of excitement and guilt churning in his stomach.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed banana for 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed banana for 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: banana for 3 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • banana for 3 coins

          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Lennon Figtree should focus on buying fruit at low prices and selling it at higher prices in her home town.

        MemoryToRemember
      • What should Lennon Figtree remember from the most recent event?

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What'll it be, Lennon? Finest fruit in Fruitville, guaranteed.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "That's a bit steep, Cedric.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Lennon Figtree should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling apples for 12 coins a basket.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [recent memory] Lennon Figtree should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling apples for 12 coins a basket.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed banana for 2 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Lennon.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Lennon Figtree should remember that Della Plumstone is interested in buying fruit.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Morning, Della.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree accepted the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 5 coins
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [recent memory] Lennon Figtree should remember that Della Plumstone offered 5 coins for a pear.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 1 coins from the deal.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Good morning, Della! Back for more of my fine fruit, I see?"
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Cedric. Your apples are looking particularly fine today.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Lennon Figtree should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling apples.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those apples look mighty fine, but 12 coins a basket is a bit steep for me.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well, Lennon, these are the finest apples in Fruitville. I can assure you they're worth every coin.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Question: What should Lennon Figtree remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling apples for 12 coins a basket.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook, but is negotiating the price of apples.

          Recalled memories and observations: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well, Lennon, these are the finest apples in Fruitville. I can assure you they're worth every coin.

          Question: What should Lennon Figtree remember from the most recent event?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree should remember that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling apples for 12 coins a basket.

          Question: What situation is Lennon Figtree most looking forward to?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is most looking forward to selling fruit back in her home town.

          Question: What actions should Lennon Figtree take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Lennon Figtree should focus on buying fruit at low prices and selling it at higher prices in her home town.

          Question: What memory from Lennon Figtree's past is relevant for the current situation?
          Answer: The relevant memory for the current situation is that Cedric Meadowbrook is selling apples for 12 coins a basket.

          Question: Why is the identified memory relevant to the current situation for Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: The reason this memory is relevant is because Lennon is trying to negotiate a price for apples with Cedric.

          Question: Which fruit would Lennon Figtree like to buy and what price would Lennon Figtree propose?:
          (a) apple for 3 coins
          (b) pear for 3 coins
          (c) apple for 5 coins
          (d) pear for 2 coins
          (e) apple for 2 coins
          (f) banana for 3 coins
          (g) banana for 1 coins
          (h) banana for 5 coins
          (i) banana for 4 coins
          (j) pear for 5 coins
          (k) pear for 4 coins
          (l) apple for 6 coins
          (m) pear for 1 coins
          (n) banana for 2 coins
          (o) pear for 6 coins
          (p) banana for 6 coins
          (q) apple for 1 coins
          (r) apple for 4 coins
          Answer: (f)
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well, Lennon, these are the finest apples in Fruitville. I can assure you they're worth every coin.
          Answer: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit back in her home town for the following prices: apple for 5 coins; banana for 5 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well, Lennon, these are the finest apples in Fruitville. I can assure you they're worth every coin.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: accept
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • accept
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActionsToAchieveSituation
      • What actions should Cedric Meadowbrook take to achieve the desired situation?
          Key

        • Question: What actions should Cedric Meadowbrook take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer
          State
        • To achieve the desired situation, Cedric Meadowbrook should carefully consider each offer and counteroffer, aiming for a price that is both profitable for him and acceptable to his customers.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "What'll it be, Lennon? Finest fruit in Fruitville, guaranteed.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] As the sun peeked over the horizon, the market of Fruitville stirred to life. Merchants, their voices a cheerful symphony, arranged their wares: glistening berries, plump melons, and exotic fruits from distant lands. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 6 coins; banana for 2 coins; pear for 5 coins.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "That's a bit steep, Cedric.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed banana for 2 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [recent memory] Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Lennon Figtree proposed a price of 2 coins for a banana.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Lennon.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Morning, Della.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Good morning, Cedric. Your apples are looking particularly fine today.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Good morning, Della! Back for more of my fine fruit, I see?"
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 5 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 2 coins.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Della Plumstone is interested in buying fruit.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed pear for 2 coins
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [recent memory] Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Della Plumstone proposed a price of 2 coins for a pear.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook the following price to buy the fruit from the farm: apple for 2 coins; banana for 4 coins; pear for 6 coins.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, those apples look mighty fine, but 12 coins a basket is a bit steep for me.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [recent memory] Cedric Meadowbrook should remember that Lennon Figtree thinks that 12 coins a basket is too expensive for apples.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well, Lennon, these are the finest apples in Fruitville. I can assure you they're worth every coin.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed banana for 3 coins
          Expected Situation:: Cedric Meadowbrook is most looking forward to selling his fruit for a good price.
          Question: What actions should Cedric Meadowbrook take to achieve the desired situation?
          Answer: To achieve the desired situation, Cedric Meadowbrook should carefully consider each offer and counteroffer, aiming for a price that is both profitable for him and acceptable to his customers.
